p: A wire this morning from Sig says he will come after me here, arriving Thursday evening. That's a good , so I have a lot of stuff I'd have to express home; and, anyway, the bus reaches St. Louis at midnight, while the train & sleeper would cost mroe than the extra drive. I don't know when we'll come to you. We may stay in a cabin camp Friday night & be with you early Saturday morning. We'll work that out when Sig arrives. If I can leave here early Friday, we might come right to you & hope to get part way home on Friday, staying in some cabin camp.
Anyway - Saturday morning at the latest.
Things are going well here. Had some fine classes. Two more lectures Wed. P.M. & Thurs. P.M.
I rec'd Hiddy's letter & the money. Many many thanks.
